title: Structs: Summary
question: Which of these are true about structs?
hint: Structs let us group together properties and methods, and are used very commonly in Swift.
correct: Structs can have as many or as few properties as you need.
Strings and arrays are both structs.
Methods that change properties must be marked mutating
You can share properties and methods across all instances of a struct using static
Computed properties let us run code to return a value.
wrong: You may either have stored properties or computed properties, but not both.
Structs may not use constant properties.
You can combine public and private in a single property.
The self keyword must not be used inside initializers.
You must always write your own initializer for structs.
